intro: Phyteuma obtusifolium, commonly known as the blunt-leaved phyteuma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to central and eastern Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. The plant produces clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of yellow to orange, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a blunt or rounded tip, giving it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
